website_summaries.verdict: The Wolf Among Us, Telltale's journey into the world of Bill Willingham's Fables, is a well-crafted point-and-click adventure game that thrills, despite being light on puzzles and challenge.

customer_reviews.title: The story is pretty linear, and it feels like your choices only ...
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations as a game. I wish there were more variations on how it can end up. The story is pretty linear, and it feels like your choices only change the story at surface level. Choices don't really make much of a difference. The story is epic. I was hooked and couldn't put it down. I played all of the episodes in 1 sitting. I wish you could download other episodes while playing the current one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Game - Poor Execution
customer_reviews.text: I really love this game, however there is considerable wait time between episodes and the last episode was so short that I finished it in less than an hour. Waiting a month for less than an hours’ worth of game play is just not worth it to me. This concept of waiting on episodes is no different than paying money for something that’s not finished yet, so if I were you I would wait until this game is completely finished, all episodes are made, before you buy, of course that could mean a year are so :-(
customer_reviews.author: dg50484

customer_reviews.title: Good game, mostly choices but it was an interesting ...
customer_reviews.text: Good game, mostly choices but it was an interesting introduction to the Fables and their world. I won't be checking out the comic book series, but I have enjoyed the game. Some choices just lead to the same place, but you can change up the story by making new choices.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful game

customer_reviews.title: I assume it's a great game based on Episode 1
customer_reviews.text: This is more a review of Telltale's customer service than the game. I got to play Episode 1, and then none of the other episodes would load. The code provided doesn't work through Steam and can only be used directly with Telltale's website. I have been trying to contact Telltale for WEEKS, and I haven't heard a peep from them. My impression is that if your game has issues, you're stuck with those issues unless the solution is found through Google. I assume it's a great game based on Episode 1, but I have no access to it.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT ACTIVATE ON STEAM, poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Great game, have been a fan of Telltale and their games since the Walking Dead series. Just a warning for those who prefer Steam. Amazon will not refund you and Telltale doesn't appear to offer Steam codes. Given the holiday season, their two new games, and their general slowness in responding, I'm expecting to wait a few weeks, and will update when I hear from them. Update: It's been over a week since I contacted Telltale Games and they have not responded. I can't play the game because it cannot connect to their servers. Taking off two stars.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother, Misogynistic
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of buying this game upon strong recommendation by a family member: not for me. I enjoy comic books (ergo, the recommendation) and fantasy settings. But not film noir. Never liked the misogyny of film noir time period. Needless to say, I got up to the point of the huntsman beating on a woman who was most likely one of ill-repute (gee, I didn't know I bought Grand Theft Auto) and dropped the game. What a waste. Don't bother.

customer_reviews.title: Wolf Among Us is a Must Play Interactive Adventure
customer_reviews.text: The Wolf Among Us is a five part story that incorporates characters and situations from the Fables comic series. It's dark, it's gritty, and the characters are amazingly adapted. Like Telltale's Walking Dead series, it's best to think of this as a choose your own interactive adventure than a typical adventure game. The story and the choices make up most of the gameplay. It's never particularly difficult, but the game forces you to make decisions quickly that impact the story. My biggest complaint is that I have to wait for the remaining episodes. Part 1 was amazing. The first episode lasts around 2 hours (your mileage will vary) and I assume the remaining episodes will follow that trend.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner Lawyer 29

customer_reviews.title: Not Fables, but pretty darn great!
customer_reviews.text: I can't really describe to you how awesome this is. It's a great inside/alternate look into Bill WIllingham's characters and how they act when you don't see them in the main storyline of Fables. I realize this is an "alternate" universe sort of situation, but it's a lot of fun and really makes me feel for the characters more. I highly suggest it, I love every chapter that's come out so far. Excitement, intrigue, and keeping me guessing around ever turn, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Abbygail

customer_reviews.title: Gripping adventure game for adults!
customer_reviews.text: Majorly impressed by this game. I think it might be better than The Walking Dead. SCORE 93/100. Imagine "The True Story of the Three Little Pigs" (a cool book my daughter loves) put in a gritty, violent, adult world (or just HBO). There are characters from fables, fairy tales, and fantasy books all mixed together in a post-fantasy, dystopian-ish world. I am hoping this game has many sequels. It's going to be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Roderic Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Waiting!
customer_reviews.text: Just hoping this game comes to kindle fire! Awesome game, please, please make it accessible for the Kindles. Worth paying for too!

customer_reviews.title: Just great
customer_reviews.text: The story in episode one is just wonderful, hoping they could continue it in two. Unlike the walking dead game, which the first one was ok and the rest were great, The wolf among us has a very strong start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The first episode was fine, but I wasn't anticipating a five month wait between episodes. If I had known (if Telltale had been honest about their release dates from the beginning) I would NOT have bought this. I feel like I have been scammed out of my money. Do not deal with this developer, save yourself the hassle, the game isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

product_meta.title: The Wolf Among Us [Download]
product_meta.description:
Platform:PC Download

From the makers of the 2012 Game of the Year: The Walking Dead comes a gritty, violent and mature thriller based on the award-winning Fables comic books (DC Comics/Vertigo). As Bigby Wolf - THE big bad wolf - you will discover that a brutal, bloody murder is just a taste of things to come in a game series where your every decision can have enormous consequences. 

An evolution of Telltale's ground-breaking choice and consequence game mechanics will ensure the player learns that even as Bigby Wolf (THE Big Bad Wolf), Sheriff of Fabletown, life in the big bad city is bloody, terrifying and dangerous. 

Over a season of content spanning across 5 episodes, available as they are released: 
 * Episode 1: Faith 
   
 * Episode 2: Smoke and Mirrors 
   
 * Episode 3: A Crooked Mile 
   
 * Episode 4: In Sheep’s Clothing 
   
 * Episode 5: Cry Wolf

• Memory: 3 GB RAM

Recommended:

• Memory: 4 GB RAM

Additional Info: Not recommended for Intel integrated graphics

Telltale account required for game activation and installation
feature_bullets: From the team that brought you 2012 Game of the Year, The Walking Dead & based on the Eisner Award-winning Fables comic book series.
Now, it's not only WHAT you choose to do that will affect your story, but WHEN you choose to do it.
A mature and gritty take on characters from fairytales, legends and folklore who have escaped into our world.
A perfect place to begin your Fables journey, even if you've not read the comics; this game is set before the events seen in the first issue.
